p: Three undescribed Amarylidaceae alkaloids, named gigantelline ( 26, Figure 2, Table 1), gigantellinine ( 27, Figure 2, Table 1 and Table 2) and gigancrinine ( 28, Figure 2, Table 1), and belonging to the cherylline- and crine-type subgroups, were isolated from the acid organic extract of C. jagus bulbs. The new alkaloids were extracted together with some already known alkaloids identified as sanguinine, cherylline, lycorine, crinine, flexinine, and the isoquinolinone derivative hippadine [ 37]. Cherylline, gigantellinine, crinine, flexinine, and sanguinine inhibited the activity of AChE in a dose-dependent manner, and the inhibition by sanguinine was remarkably effective (IC 50 = 1.83 ± 0.01 μM), while cherylline and hippadine showed weak cytotoxicity at 100 μM [ 37].
